bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, June 25, 1929

div1.p: Russell explains Frost will resume work on the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever in early August.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, June 25, 1929
div1.opener:
Book
Misel,
Russell
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
---
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D., DIRECTOR
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
SCIENTIFIC DIRECTORS
---
RUFUS COLE, M.D., CHAIRMAN
EUGENE L. BISHOP, M.D.
LOUIS I. DUBLIN, Ph.D.
WADE H. FROST, M.D.
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
WILSON G. SMILLIE, M.D.
C.-E. A. WINSLOW, Dr. P.H.
June 25, 1929
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I have your note of June 22, 1929. I am glad
to see you are at “Dunlora”. Please present my compli-
ments to Mrs. Darling. I had hoped to have seen her
either here or in Charlottesville long before this, and
still have some hope of going down there during the summer
or fall.

I did not see Dr. Frost before he sailed, but
the last time I saw him he told me he was going definite-
ly to work on the manuscript as soon as he returned from
Europe about the first of August.

I hope that your time in the country will be a
real vacation.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura A. Carter
“Dunlora”
Box 453
Charlottesville
Virginia
FFR:R:DH
